case.state: Here I... Uh... You do know you came with your thing out already, right, ~player~?
Here I... Uh... Huh, I imagined this place would be a bit liberal with rules but I wasn't expecting someone to just show up like that already.
What is it with me and having to climb to the top of towers to get where I want... At least this one wasn't full of monsters on the way up...
Hmmm... I guess Satan did end up sending me to a hot spring after all... At least he is not here too like he wanted back then...

This place is obviously a classroom... but I can tell it's not for any kind of magic school. Are strip poker schools a thing in this world? I hope I don't have to take an entire course to enter the game.
Here I am!
I'll do my best!
No way, did I really just run into her?
(Wait, is that girl...)
~human~, do you really want to play a game like this against a butterfly?
Uh...Yeah that is a bit of an important thing to miss, you see what you do here is... strip poker...
We have enough to start, but I think it would be a good idea to wait for a couple more players.
If you want this to feel private we could start now. I wouldn't mind letting someone else join before that, though.
If this were a Puyo duel instead of a card game, we could have a real fun battle between just us four.
One more joins, but I still see a spot for one more.
And now we should be good to go!
Last chance, whoever doesn't want to stay, leave so we can find our last player.
The table is full, the cards are ready, shall we start?
Ringo! I found you! As soon as I knew games were being played here I knew I had to search for you here.
Ringo! I found you! As soon as I knew games were being played here I knew I had to search for you here.
(The game is starting... I guess I can probably ask her during the game...)
Hmmm, the butterfly can talk, alright, so what is it? Illusion magic, transformation, or the real player is just going to come out of nowhere when it loses a round?
I mean, if you want, you can still leave. Otherwise, I'm sure everyone here will be glad to play with you.
I originally came here looking for a friend of mine. But I might as well take the chance to let off some steam. A girl has her needs, you know?
Anyone here seen a redhead girl with drill twintails? No? I guess I can keep searching after the game.
I was originally searching for someone around here, but this game sounds like an opportunity I can't pass.
The friend I'm looking for doesn't seem to be at this table, but I think I'll take the chance to let off some steam. Our little secret, right?
Now is when we change cards? Uh... I'll take ~cards.text~ then.
Oh, right. We can change cards... Uh... I guess ~cards.text~.
Ah I think I get it, if I change ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~ I should have a better chance, right?
So... If I remember correctly, I can change ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~, right?
I'll cast warp on ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~.
~Cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~ please.
Swap!
Time to swap.
I'll be taking ~cards.text~.
Would ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~ help me? I sure hope so.
Dealer, give me ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~ please.
I want to change ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~ now.
Luck, don't fail me now.
Throw away the small numbers, right? Wait, is the A a small number or a big one?
Honestly, I'm just going to keep this card because it looks nice to this other one.
No strategy here, just swapping ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~ here.
If changing ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~ doesn't help me, then nothing will!
So... Do we have to say if our hand is good? This one gives me a good feeling.
Feeling super good!
I actually arrived to this world with my pet Carby. I left him outside before we started the game though. I don't think he needs to see whatever ends up happening here.
It doesn't matter how much the other players have, I'm not the type to just let anyone outdo me like that!
I think this is a good hand. Yep-siree!
Are these cards filled with magic? I can somehow feel the power from this hand rushing through me!
This hand is in tip-top shape!

I doubt that this world has to worry about it, but if you see a weird eyeball creature that emits a strange mist, don't breathe it in. It's a Yog, and breathing the mist will get you under their evil influence.
This version of poker is easier than the one I played that other time. I don't even think you need to bluff in this one.
Yup, this looks good...
Lucky!

I'm going to assume no one here knows about Puyo battles, right? Basically we use a spell called "Owanimo" to pop four creatures called "Puyos" that are the same color to power up our magic spells, super handy to save MP.

Did you guys know that on top of powering Puyo battles, the liquids inside the Puyos make for great juice? My friends kinda freaked out when I mentioned this. I still enjoy a Puyo refresher every now and then.
With hands like these I should be good for the long run!
You're not getting through my Arle shield with hands like these!
Let's just say my hand is making me believe in beginner's luck!
This hand is great to keep me covered for now. I kinda hope I don't end up missing out on the fun entirely though.
You're gonna have to be lucky if you want to get me out of the game this turn.
Looks like luck wants me to stay playing for a bit longer.
Just the set of Puy... I mean cards I needed to stay in game.
I may be naked but I'm not out, not with a hand like this one!

A full moon like tonight's is sure to power any magic spells around. Be sure to be careful, or you could turn something small like a 10 second memory spell into a full memory wipe. I was at the wrong end of something like that once.
I do like hot springs like these... It's just that, if I stay for longer than 30 mins inside one I start getting dizzy.
Any of you guys like curry? My little pet Carby loves it, so I kinda became pretty good at making it.

So I take it Puyo battles aren't a thing around here, right? I guess it's a good thing I learned how to do spells before even learning how to do those. A lot of my friends have become a bit too dependent on them.
Well, nothing else to do for now.
I used to think my own world was really big, but me and my friends keep landing on other worlds, and they just seem to be bigger and bigger each time.
Sometimes I feel like I'm cursed because everywhere I end up, weird things start happening. But somehow, I have the feeling like the weirdness today has nothing to do with me.

Are you guys ok if I told you a little story about myself? I used to live in a different world. Spent my first 16 years on it and had lots of adventures, until one day I got magically transported to a different one.
A couple years ago I actually got kidnapped and thrown into a dungeon. The adventure that followed my escape was what eventually led me to my dear Carby. We've been inseparable since!
My friends Amitie and Ringo have such weird ways to do Puyo battles. Fever, transformation, windmill, underwater... And I thought Sun rules were complex enough.
Knowing when to counter is the key for a fever match. I don't know if this hand can counter enough things though...
I used to like circuses. Until one time the ringmaster turned out to be a brainwashed Satan. Trying to steal my dear Carby for some kind of lookalike of mine.
In a way this feels like a tournament of sorts. Losers get eliminated and there's a prize at the end. Even if in this case it's not really a tangible one, per se.
Right outside of Primp, there's this big field filled with flowers and a windmill. It makes for the best resting spot if you don't mind the sun, that is.
There was this one time I learnt a strength spell. I went around town just grabbing whole doors out of their frame and just tossing them away! I spent the next 2 months fixing those same doors...

I'm not planning to drink it right now since there's no need for it, but, there's this potion, I believe you people here call it "sake". It's great to restore mana. Do you guys think this place sells it?
I really don't know what would've become of me if I couldn't do magic. I'm not really one to fit into a more... how does Ringo call it? "Urban" lifestyle.
I've met so many types of creatures... from giant fish that grow legs, to bear-squirrel-human hybrids, even a couple of forces you could call "deities". And this place seems to be pretty varied too.
Puyo battles are great and all. But I kinda miss the old times where I would just go through dungeons, open chests and face enemies with raw magic instead.
I've had people call me "Silvana" in the past. I have no idea where that even came from.
Back in my original world, we had these "oxygen gummies" that allowed you to breathe underwater. I have no clue if the effects are permanent or temporary and now I'm kinda scared to test that out.
For as much as I like Primp, I couldn't believe they didn't know what curry was when I arrived. Besides a couple of my friends, it still hasn't caught on there, but that just means more curry for me!
Mmm! The breeze feels nice here. Is it a good place to play with cards though?
Na~nana Na~na~nana~nana~nana Na~nana~nana Puyo Puyo
I wonder if this place serves curry. I may need to warn the owner about my Carby if that's the case. I saw him eat an entire curry stand once because of how hungry he can get.
Well, I guess whether I stay in game or get to enjoy myself will depend more on you than me.
Hmmm... A hand that is neither good nor bad is like placing Puyos on your field randomly just waiting for the color you need.
Anyone here ever met a mermaid? All the ones I've ran into seem to have quite the persecution complex.
Any of you have pets? My little Carby and I have been together for forever now. Everything seems to be more fun when I'm with him!
Have any of you guys also been thrown into a different world all of the sudden at any point? I admit it was a bit scary at first, but luckily Primp town is such a warm and beautiful spot.

How quickly do you guys think could adapt to getting thrown into a completely unknown place and try to survive in it? Even if I got lucky when I landed on Primp, I feel like I have enough survival skills to live on my own.
You guys wouldn't mind giving me an example of what a bad hand is, right?
Hmmm... I feel like this isn't what I'm supposed to have if I want to win the round.
When I was really small I passed my first magic exam by rolling a pencil and letting it select the answers. I don't think that type of luck is with me today though.
Oh well, I guess it's too late to fix this hand now.
Could I cast a Diacute on this hand to make it a bit better? Not even a little?
Awww...
I've been told sometimes that I'm naive for not showing concern over some of my problems. But I know that whenever they come I can deal with them... Like this hand...
I'll take whatever outcome comes from this hand.
I don't think this hand is good enough, and I don't even remember the rules that well...
Yep... even I can tell this one is bad...
Back when I adventured in dungeons, I used to live on the money I got from defeating enemies. Primp has less places like that so I need to find other ways to get by.

So picture this, there's this guy called "Satan", though some people call him "Dark Prince" instead. Anyways, he seems to be super fixated on making me his wife. It gets even creepier considering the guy was my old magic school principal.
Oh no...
This hand is not nice.
I think I'm in trouble here...
Sometimes you can just tell your opponent has a bigger chain and all you can do is hope he ends up ruining it somehow. Could I expect one of you to ruin your hands for me this time?
Well, I might as well get ready...
I'm willing and even slightly wanting to undress here, but I'd rather not be the loser this round...
I don't mind losing a round or two, but I'd rather see someone else lose instead, you know?
That trade looked like a better idea in my head than how it came out...
Biscuits...
To Puyo hell with this hand...
Well, that could have gone better...
This hand feels as bad as someone throwing a bathtub on your head...
What could I have done better there...
Does anyone have pickled onions? I may need some serious healing after this hand.
I feel like this is going to be it for me...
Well, it was a good run. I think.
Well... Biscuits...
Fine, if I'm going out, at least I'll do it in my own terms.
I guess this is it.
I guess there's still hope that someone had it worse.
I did say I wanted to let off some steam, didn't I? I guess my wish is about to become truth.
I'm fine with taking a couple hits right now.
Oh well, I guess there's always next round.
This round's hand doesn't look great, but I still have plenty of fight in me!
Well. There really wasn't much I could do there anyways.
Even if I lose this hand, I can still keep going!
Awww... I guess I'll have to give this round away...
Luck wasn't really on my side on that one, huh?
Huh... I thought it was worth the risk when I traded cards...
Now I just wish I played a couple more games back in that other poker place...
This is bad, and it's not like I can afford losing rounds at this point.
So many mistakes are costing me hard, and if I keep getting hands like this I may be out sooner than I'd like.
Welp, that's what I get for trying to go for risky hands...
Man, I really was hoping this wouldn't be the hand I'd end up with...
Grrreeaat...
I am trying, I just can't seem to get lucky...
Come on, luck doesn't treat me this bad when we're talking about Puyo dropsets.
It's not too late to mention that it's been a while since I played this "poker" thing, right? My name is Arle, by the way.
Howdy-do. My name is Arle. Puyo is more my thing but I'll be giving it my all in this game.
Oh this seems to be a different type of poker, huh? Oh, sorry, my name is Arle by the way.
Well, it's down to us, think you can beat me on a one-on-one Puy... I mean poker battle?
Well, it's down to us, and while you do have the advantage, I'm not planning to go without a fight!

If you were able to travel between worlds. I bet you'd love a place like Primp, we got ancient ruins, lots of nature and weird creatures of all kinds for you to study. You could even help me learn a thing or two too!

I guess it's part and part for me, Kumatora. I was originally searching for Ringo. But, a game like this, in a place where almost no-one knows me? Sounds like a great spot to let some steam off without judgment from others.

You're looking at one of them right here! Ringo and I have been super close since we started having adventures together. I kinda wish Amitie was here too but, I honestly have no Idea if she would be a good fit for a game like this.
It's quite a long story for me... But basically I asked a couple of favors while trying to find a friend of mine and I ended up here.
At this point, that would probably be Satan's constant attempts to get a date with me...
Well, Carby and I usually reward ourselves with a good plate of curry after a big adventure... Then again we always give ourselves some curry after most adventures.

Say, since I can tell you are really nervous about that. If any of us sees a boat out there, I can cast an illusion of a dragon on the water, that should either scare or distract them enough to not be a worry for us.
You're right... There is only one bed. The guys running this place must be expecting things to get really spicy after the game, huh?
Some fun on the pool does sound nice, we can do that after the game if we still have energy though.
Sheesh, you really have no filter with stuff like that huh? More importantly... What's an "e~ye~dee"?
Oh, you are married to her? Huh... Sorry I misunderstood your relation at first then. I guess "old married couple" also fits the way you two are acting.
Right, I guess you weren't here when they explained that part. So... the thing is if we are naked and we lose another hand we have to, um... Play with ourselves...

So you'd say that "keyblade" is more of a magic channeler or a booster? I've managed to learn magic without needing one of those, but using gadgets like that does seem to be a common thing with the people at Primp.
Oh, you are married to her? Huh... I never expected a monarch to marry her butler, I guess when you are the ruler you do get to marry whoever you want.
It's not called resourceful, Aqua, Debuff yourself if you have any self respect...
The fact that you're a goddess is why you should be ashamed of cheating, now debuff yourself!
That... feels like a gross waste of a magic transformation, Shamiko.
Hey, Ringo? Are you there? She really is just lost looking at him, isn't she?

It's probably better that you didn't do that. I was once a prisoner in a dungeon myself, and my, let's say... "feminine charms" were what distracted the guards enough for me to knock them out and escape.
If you are talking about curry ramen, you can count me in, sister!
Hey, if the game devolves into something like that later... I may not be completely against that idea, Zone...
Well, Natsuki, I can't guarantee I'll be around for long, but I certainly would be open for one night experiences...
Isn't that overcomplicating stuff a bit? Why not just cast a heedon, a sleep spell, or a mind blast. Unless you really prefer to make people depressed over getting them to sleep or confused.
Considering what the "ideals" of some people are, I just prefer truth.
I'll bite. What can you say about me?
Considering your situation, the fact that you already played along for a bit is already great! So at least I won't hold it against you if you leave later.
Howdy-do. My name is Arle... Wait, are you two playing together, as in the same hand and all?
I don't really think you need to do much to be honest, guys just seem to attract themselves to us... I just happen to attract the worst kind all the time...
Well Aqua, it just so happens that one-on-one battles are my specialty! May the best sorcerer win!
Pressure? None at all! May the best sorcerer win!
Well Aqua, it just so happens that one-on-one battles are my specialty! May the best sorcerer win!
Pressure? None at all! May the best sorcerer win!
Well Aqua, it just so happens that one-on-one battles are my specialty! May the best sorcerer win!
I'm not much of an instrument player... I did give a shot to dancing at one point, along with some of my old friends. Seeing Schezo on a Salsa outfit was quite something...

I guess it's part and part for me, Kumatora. I was originally searching for a friend of mine, but, a game like this, in a place where no-one knows me? Sounds like a great spot to let some steam off without judgment from others.

Well, one of them is actually the reason I arrived here. After she got teleported during a Puyo battle, me and a couple common... "acquaintances" managed to track her down to this world. So I came to investigate.
I actually know what it is to be trapped in a cage. It happened long ago now, and that's the reason why I always let my Carby be as free as he wants.
Well. I may not have a dog. But ever since I rescued Carbuncle from one of my earlier adventures, we've been together and inseparable!
I absolutely adore nature. Nothing beats falling to the fresh grass early in the morning and rest as the sun comes up!
Yeah. I'm lucky that my grandma took care of me when I was small. But I know what it's like to grow without your parents. So I know a bit of how you feel.
You can never beat curry! And I bet with your experience, yours may be close to being as good as mine!
The name does not sound familiar, Aqua. However, we do have a little park in Primp town where we can practice friendly Puyo duels.
You may be running a flawless game so far, but so have I, May the best sorcerer win!
You may be running a flawless game so far, but I won't get discouraged by that! May the best sorcerer win!
Pressure? None at all! May the best sorcerer win!
As long as you are not using that "keyblade" to give yourself an unfair advantage. You shouldn't count me out! May the best sorcerer win!

I did keep a journal, back when I first landed at Primp, hoping that I would find a way to get back to my original world. Eventually when I decided to stay there I ended up donating it to the town's library instead.

Hmmm... I don't think I have any enemies like that. I mean, from the strongest foes I've faced, one of them is just obsessed with making me her wife, and the other one was just an immature boy that just needed a guiding hand.
I'm not going to do this to be a showoff, but because I want to help you with your feet situation... Healing!
Hey! What's the deal here, using magic to cover yourself shouldn't be allowed!
For real, outside of the nice looks I can feel my boots sticking to the floor. If Kikimora was here she would be going crazy and ready to clean it all up.
Well, the most I've been able to do was to make me hover for a couple of seconds, but trying to focus the spell you use to make the broom fly on yourself, rather than the broom could be worth a shot.
Huh? Yeah I remember saying that but... What are you thinking about?
You settle your problems with strip fights? That's... quite a interesting way to deal with stuff...
Reading a story while touching yourself? Is it going to be a perverted story? 'cause otherwise that's gonna be hard to focus on at the same time.

Straight to the point, are we, Mari? Sadly I don't have experience with that kinda stuff yet... And as long as you don't do any weird succubus or vampire thing, maybe we could try to fix that a bit later. What'd ya think?
Oh... That's probably the creature I saw Carby chasing after when I told him to wait outside. Don't worry I bet those two will get along just nice... Hopefully...

The cutest thing? That probably was the one time my pet Carby faced the Tetra crew's mascot "O". Nothing cuter than two pets throwing spells at each other trying to knock each other out... Hmm... That sounded wrong...

state.text: She seems to be in more of a shock to see me than I expected... Anyways, I'm Arle, and my twintailed friend is called Ringo. Don't mind us, I'm sure once the shock passes she'll be glad to play as well.

case.state: Ah yes.. The fresh feel of grass on my feet. There's few things as relaxing as this...
Ah yes.. The fresh feel of grass on my feet. There's few things as relaxing as this...
This sand may be soft, but it's also really hot from the sun, so give me a second to cast a protection spell on everyone's feet, that way, none of us will get burnt.
This sand may be soft, but it's also really hot from the sun, so give me a second to cast a protection spell on everyone's feet, that way, none of us will get burnt.
Considering the limited time I have around here... Yeah, today would probably be the best option. As for who, well that's kinda what I meant when I was asking for your help.
Well, I got a bit of a limited time around these parts, but, maybe if we end up playing this again together we can try to make something happen?
Well, as I said earlier, as long as there's no weird shenanigans going on, I would be up to try some stuff.
Took you a bit longer than I thought to catch on. I thought you succubi specialty was to jump right into stuff like this.
Well then, sounds like we got the perfect opportunity for that during this game, don't 'cha think?
I'm tempted to call you "Kuma". But you don't really look like a bear.

I don't know if Ecolo knows, but considering Satan's reaction once he figured out where you were. I think he may have a clue. I made him promise not to spy on us after I beat him in a Puyo battle though, so don't worry about that.
That does seem to happen a lot more since you joined us, huh? It does seem we rarely get any more local smaller time adventures anymore.
Dangerous tea being given by shady skeletons. Now where have I heard that one before?
Well, I don't know what a "Gallade" is, but you definitely are wider down there than most guys I know, Hilbert.
W... wow... You really are just going to prepare ramen here while totally naked and while the game is still going, huh?
Remind me why are we doing this in such a cold place?
Being so exposed in such a cold place... Is enduring the cold part of the game too?
Oh! These two have the same number! That's good right?!
A pair of identical Puyo... I mean cards in my hand!
Having two cards that look identical must be worth more than just random cards, right?
Awww... I was hoping this fifth card would also end up being the same as the other four...
Oh! This hand is like having one of those big Puyos that you can change color of at will and count as four, right?!
All of these cards have the same symbol, that's gotta count for something, right?
These cards have the same color and are in order too. If I remember correctly, that's like incredibly good, right?!
Well I guess whoever looked closely a moment ago confirmed that my hair color is indeed natural...
On that new world I also ended up having tons of adventures, even if I felt alone on what was a strange place for me at the time.
Over time, however, I grew to love that new world, the world of Primp and all the people I met there.
After some time, even some of my old acquaintances and friends managed to make their way to Primp too.
Which is why, even if Primp Town may not be my true place of origin. I've lived there for long enough and grown so attached to it I could even call it my home.
I really could use some extra mana to help me at this point, I think I actually saw someone around here with one, he called it "sake" I believe?
I guess we are deep enough into this game that more intimate questions aren't out of the way so, is anyone here hoping for a little "extra" to happen after the game? If you know what I mean?
Since I'm showing quite a bit of skin... What do you guys usually prefer, what's above or what's below?

A couple of my acquaintances guaranteed to me she was around here. She's probably just at a different table, so in the meanwhile, why not take the chance? Games like these are hard to come by where I come from.
Well, there is a slight luck factor involved, but whatever drop set you get is the same your opponent does, so at the end of the day, skill is what decides the winner and the loser.
Of course it does. Both technical, in order to use the Puyos to set up and trigger chains, and magical skill, to actually pull off the attacks!

I'll admit some recent adventures have been less grim since I landed in Primp. But that doesn't mean I haven't been in high stakes missions either. Besides, I think you know I mean to relieve a different type of stress...
You mock it, but trust me, you wouldn't want to be at the other end of a Puyo battle with me.
You know what Aqua, you're right. Two can play that game, Diacute!
Well, that's how we call it, but it's not literal garbage. We just do so because it fills our playing field and doesn't do anything useful.
You'd be correct! Several years in magic school plus a ton of actual battles, but one never stops learning. Wouldn't you agree?

I guess that depends on what a spirit would find interesting... From what I've seen of this one so far, with the type of people and the stuff they do, this one sure seems to be a candidate for "most interesting world" so far...
A kit~su~ne~ ancestry? I'm not sure what you mean with that word, but if you mean like a sorcerer relative, then yeah. From what I heard my father also used to be a pretty good magician.
Oh, not really Nagatoro. This is more just of a relic from my older adventures where it definitely was necessary. I just got too used to wearing it nowdays.
Oh that's simple, Nonon. They're these little colorful blobs that inhabit my world. We pop them to get magic from them to use our spells, and they are also quite a nice fresh drink!
Sadly Akko, despite my dad being a great wizard, I didn't inherit his power from birth, so I went to a magic school, just as you seem to have done.
Well, most of my spells are offensive and defensive, so I guess you could say my specialization is combat magic, Akko.
No need to charge a wand or any type of accessory for me, Akko. The way I get mana is either by resting, doing Puyo matches, or this one drink... I think people around here call it "sake".

Don't worry about it, Akko. The game would be a bit boring if we just focused on it after all. I guess you could say my discipline is combat magic, both offensive and defensive, with a couple other utility spells, great for dungeon exploring!

Nothing wrong with performance magic. Honestly, considering how calm things can be sometimes at Primp, I'm considering enrolling into their magic school just to learn a couple performance tricks myself.
Yep. While I ended up learning a bit of basic self defense magic on my own when I was little, I couldn't have become the sorcerer I am today without the stuff I learnt at magic school.
Well, depending on the type of monster they may already have one, Akko. At least some of them did back in my world.
Well I did use to go for loot in dungeons a lot when I was younger, but I can probably count with my hands the amount of times I've actually went with a party, Akko.
Depends on the adventure, I guess. Recently it's been a lot of adventures with my friends Ringo and Amitie, but when I was younger I used to go on more solo adventures.
Ceremonial gear? No, this is just what I normally wear, Akko.
Well, I'm from a world of magic, but I guess I would call myself a sorcerer rather than a witch, Akko.
Are magic people really that rare around these parts, Akko? I guess if they are I can see why you'd be happy to see someone like me.
I mean, it's interesting for me too, Akko. 'Specially since I never fully mastered morphing spells myself.
Are magic people really that rare around these parts, Akko? I haven't been around these parts long enough to figure it out myself.
Yeah, don't worry about that either. Ecolo is a time and space traveler, remember? I told him not to come pick us up until tomorrow though, so we have plenty of time to do whatever we want here.
Oh boy, it's been a while since I last faced a dragon, and honestly, the best I could do then was just knock him out, then again... It was a circus dragon and I didn't really want to hurt him.
You mentioned earlier something about a teacher marrying one of your classmates. Right Nagisa? It's a bit different in my case. No matter how many times I tell him no. He just doesn't listen.
Well, yeah, of course I'm playing the game till the end. I can't speak for Ringo, but games like these are a rare thing to find around from where I'm from.
Wait... Sonic... As in Sonic the Hedgehog? You know him too? Am I back on his world?
Not a knight, but a sorcerer. However I've been stuck away from my original world for a bit now, so I have no clue if it is doing alright or not.
Well, yeah but trust me, it's not because I never wanted to dabble into stuff like this, it's just... all the guys that are usually around me don't exactly do it for me, you know?
I don't usually pay attention to what I wear, I kinda use the same outfit all year around to be honest.
How long? Well, for "Puyo Puyo" matches, I found about the "Owanimo" spell when I was around 16, but puyos in general are just native creatures of my world.

Well, you aren't that far off to be honest. After all, Puyos are squishy-like round creatures. Just be careful about which you try to squeeze. Some are burning hot, some freezing cold, and some will shock you on touch.
The Arle? Well I guess there are other creatures that look like me out there somewhere, but yeah, I guess I am the Arle, Chiaki.
Oh come on! Twice in a row?
I know joining a game like this without that much poker experience was a mistake. But we can probably have someone else lose the next round, right?
I don't suppose you guys would lend me a hand next round to break this streak, right?
I know what I'm risking by entering this game, I just hope I don't have to deal with a big losing streak.
Huh... I guess I didn't learn my lesson from the previous round.

Come on. I didn't do that bad on that other type of Poker...
Enough is enough!
I'm starting to get angry with this bad streak.
Great... I guess it's my turn... Again...
Seriously?! Four times in a row?
I'm starting to see you guys have no mercy.
I may believe in fate a bit, and I hate my own fate right now...
This is just ridiculous now. Five straight?!
If you guys stacked the deck you might as well tell me so I can skip to my forfeit.
I'm not even going to mention it...
I can't say I'm not having doubts about this. It's not so much the nudity itself, but... I'd rather do this somewhere...warmer?
I guess I should have expected this... But don't get overconfident. I may not learn as fast as my friend Ringo, but I won't let you all trample over me either!
I had hope to not lose the first round, but don't get overconfident. I'm not one to just let myself get trampled over!
Hmmm... I kinda hoped to hold on for at least one round...
Yeah... No surprise here. But I'll get the hang of this thing before you know it!
I've never really liked Sun rules... Which is why I tend to avoid games near beaches.

Can we make this a Puyo or magic battle instead?

Man... I guess it's that time already, huh?
Well, it's going to happen now, huh?
I'm not going to count my hairband, so that just leaves one thing left...
Well, it's not like I expected a flawless game here. Just having survived more than one round without losing was already great for me.
Let's not try to fool anyone, I wasn't going to get through this game unbeaten.
I honestly would have been disappointed if you guys didn't make me lose at least once.
Well, I guess you guys are getting to my good stuff now, huh?
A part of me hoped the game wouldn't make me do this, but the other one is a bit excited about it.
I have conflicting thoughts about this. It's exciting, but it's also making me a bit nervous too.
You got me.
Guess I'm out this time...
Yeah. I lost again, but you guys still got a long way to go!
It's not over yet!

I think I'm starting to remember this a game a bit better now, so don't get too cocky!

I guess as naturally as it gets once you study the spell enough, and once the word started to spread around, it really spread fast, you could even say it became a fad back in my original world.

That's the best part, after it's all over, whatever Puyos don't pop they just magically go away. No cleanup needed!

Well, the book said that they get teleported to a different world, and... I'm not sure on this but, I think it's actually that way how I accidentally ended up teleporting myself to Primp as well.

Of course! I got a full day to find her before one of those acquaintances shows up to pick us up, and even if I don't find her by then, having him around should make pinpointing her location even easier.

Well... It's been quite a while since the last time we had to actually do more than knock out an "evil" guy. Most of the times we just use em to duel for fun.
You know, getting me from fully clothed to completely naked in one go is making me reflect on some stuff...
To be honest I tend to not change my clothes much. I've been wearing blue and white pretty much my entire life.
I guess this vest is the closest you'll see me wearing an "accessory" of sorts, one that doesn't help with combat that is.
Wristbands like these are basic for a magic user like me. They help during combat and they're warm and comfy!
Even when out of battle, these wristbands are warm and soft.
I tried using gloves at some point along with my wristbands, but they seemed to block a bit of my magic ability, so that didn't last.
Well, this place won't get warmer any time soon, so let's just do this...
I've used these for more than 15 years... I'm not one to really change my outfits much...
I've worn this combination of white and blue since I can remember. I don't tend to change my wardrobe much...
My father used to wear armor similar to this... Or so I'm told. I never really got to meet him.
Well, here we go. I knew this could happen when I entered the game, but I'd lie if I didn't say I'm still a bit nervous about it.
Sleeves are basic for a magic user like me. They help during combat and they're warm and comfy!
Even when out of battle, these sleeves are warm and soft.
I tried using gloves at some point along with my sleeves, but they seemed to block a bit of my magic ability, so that didn't last.
I don't have many pairs of boots. Thankfully they all seem to be very durable. They've handled rough terrain and long adventures for years!
My pair of boots have been with me through highs and lows... What I'm trying to say is I don't really have much footwear...
Hold on... I'm just trying to take off this skirt. Not what's below it.
I'll take off my skirt first... Oops, seems like something else wanted to go down with it...
I don't think I've let anyone outside of Carby see me like I'm about to be...
I don't really have anyone I've been intimate with... so this will be the first time I let anyone see me like this... that I know of.
Considering the other two uses on my original world for them are getting whacked around on dungeons for xp, or being used as drinks. I think teleporting them away is the best outcome for them.
I just don't really see the point in stuff like that. I prefer practicality over fashion every time.
Yeah... Even I can tell those guys are... unique. Just not in the way I'd like to get closer to.
Yeah! Just enjoy and relax, and once we get back home, this place, and whatever happens tonight can be our nice little secret.

Yeah... I guess so, Ringo. I hope it's not too weird for you.
Well, Lotte. What do you think? Am I ready to write a ~fa~n~fic~?

I don't have many pairs of boots. Thankfully they all seem to be very durable. They've handled rough terrains and long adventures for years!

Win or lose, let's all have fun!

Whatever your magic is, remember to use it with caution. I once used my Ice Storm so much that I ended up getting frostbite burns on my hands. It was not pretty.

What kind of spells do you know? I hope none that would help you cheat today.

I've only ever worn a school uniform once: the first time I landed on my friend Ringo's world. My memories of that entire deal are kinda fuzzy, though. I guess it's a side effect of being possessed for most of that adventure.
My magic school didn't really have uniforms. I guess me and my classmates used to dress kinda similar, but looking back, it feels like most of us just used white and blue for some reason.

I've seen what loneliness can do to some people, just remember that if you need any friends. We'll be here for you.

You look like the type of girl that prefers to use your fists to fix your problems. Is there any other thing those hands can do?

Sheesh, I don't think I've seen any humanoid creatures as tall as you besides Satan.

Revia!
